Universal bound valid at all times
Page-like curve for the entanglement entropy
title: The Entropy of Radiation for Local Quenches in Higher Dimensions.pdf
abstract: We investigate the real time dynamics of the radiation produced by a local quench in a d-dimensional conformal field theory (CFT) with d > 2. Using the interpre- tation of the higher-dimensional twist operator as a conformal defect, we study the time evolution of the entanglement entropy of the radiation across a spherical entangling surface. We provide an analytic estimate for the early- and late-time behavior of the entanglement entropy and derive an upper bound valid at all times. We extend our analysis to the case of a boundary CFT (BCFT) and derive similar results through a detailed discussion of the setup with two conformal defects (the boundary and the twist operator). We conclude with a holographic analysis of the process, computing the time evolution of the holographic entanglement entropy (HEE) as the area of the Ryu-Takayanagi surface in a backreacted geometry. This gives a Page-like curve in agreement with the early- and late-time results obtained with CFT methods. The extension to a holographic BCFT setup is generically hard and we consider the case of a tensionless end-of-the-world brane. Keywords: Conformal field theories, Entanglement entropy, Holography arXiv:2502.00105v2 [hep-th] 12 Feb 2025
